align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 0in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 1in; text-align: left"><B>ITEM 
2.02</B></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>Results of Operations and 
Financial Conditions.</B></TD>
</TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 
42.1pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 
42.1pt">On September 13, 2012, Samson Oil &amp;
Gas Limited issued a press release announcing financial results for the fiscal 
year ended June 30, 2012 and that it had concurrently
filed its Annual Report for the fiscal year ended June 30, 2012 with the 
Australian Securities Exchange and its Annual Report on
Form 10-K with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.&nbsp;&nbsp;A copy of
the press release is furnished as Exhibit 99.1
hereto.&nbsp;&nbsp;A copy of the ASX Annual Report for the fiscal year ended 
June 30, 2012 is furnished as Exhibit 99.2 hereto.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 
42.1pt">The information contained in this Item
2.02 (including Exhibit 99.1 and Exhibit 99.2) shall not be deemed 
&ldquo;filed&rdquo; for purposes of Section 18 of the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &ldquo;Exchange Act&rdquo;), or 
incorporated by reference in any filing under the Securities
Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange Act, except as shall be expressly set 
forth by specific reference in such filing.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.75in;
text-indent: -0.75in"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-99.1
<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>v323834_ex99-1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-99.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
     <TITLE></TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<P STYLE="margin: 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>Exhibit 99.1</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><IMG SRC="logo.jpg" ALT=""></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><B>SAMSON OIL
&amp; GAS LODGES 30 JUNE<FONT STYLE="text-transform: uppercase">
2012 FINANCIAL report AND 30 June 2012 fORM 10-K</FONT> </B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Denver September 13<SUP>th</SUP> 2012,
Perth September 14<SUP>th</SUP>, 2012</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited (AMEX: SSN;
ASX: SSN) today lodged its fiscal 2012 Annual Report (using International 
Financial Reporting Standards) with the ASX and filed
its fiscal 2012 Form 10-K (including financial statements using US Generally 
Accepted Accounting Principles) for the year ended
30 June 2012. A copy of both reports is available in full on the Company&rsquo;s
website (<U>www.samsonoilandgas.com</U>).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Samson&rsquo;s Ordinary Shares are traded
on the Australian Securities Exchange under the symbol &quot;SSN&quot;. Samson's
American Depository Shares (ADSs) are traded on
the New York Stock Exchange MKT under the symbol &quot;SSN&quot;.&nbsp; Each ADS
represents 20 fully paid Ordinary Shares of Samson.
Samson has a total of 1,996 million ordinary shares issued and outstanding 
(including 250 million options exercisable at AUD 1.5
cents), which would be the equivalent of 99.8 million ADSs.&nbsp; Accordingly, 
based on the NYSE MKT closing price of US$1.23 per
ADS on September 13<SUP>th</SUP>, 2012 the Company has a current market 
capitalization of approximately US$119.0 million.&nbsp;
Correspondingly, based on the ASX closing price of A$0.054 on September 
13<SUP>th</SUP>, 2012, the Company has a current market
capitalization of A$105.0 million.&nbsp; The options have been valued at their 
closing price of A$0.041on September 13<SUP>th</SUP>,
2012 and translated to US$ at the current exchange of 1.0471 for purposes of 
inclusion in the US$ market capitalization calculation.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 30%">For and on behalf of the board of</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 70%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold">SAMSON OIL &amp; GAS LIMITED</TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; font-weight: 
bold">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="border-right: windowtext 1pt solid; font-weight: bold"><IMG 
SRC="sig1.jpg" ALT=""></TD>
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="border-right: windowtext 1pt solid; border-bottom: 
windowtext 1pt solid; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle">For further 
information please contact, Terry Barr, CEO on<BR>
303 296 3994 (US office) or 970 389 5047 (US cell)</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold">TERRY BARR</TD>
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD>Managing Director</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">A description of the risks and uncertainties
that are generally attendant to Samson and its industry, as well as other 
factors that could affect Samson&rsquo;s financial results,
are included in the Company's report on Form 10-K, which is available at <FONT 
STYLE="text-underline-style: none; color: 
windowtext">www.sec.gov/edgar/searchedgar/webusers.htm</FONT>.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

SRC="footer.jpg" ALT=""></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>DIRECTORS&rsquo; REPORT</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>30 June 2012 </B></P>
<!-- Field: Rule-Page --><DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="margin-top: 0; margin-
bottom: 0"><DIV STYLE="font-size: 1pt; border-top: Black 1pt solid; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</DIV></DIV><!-- Field: /Rule-Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>DIRECTORS&rsquo; REPORT</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">In accordance with a resolution of Directors,
the Directors submit their report with respect to the results of the operations 
of Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited (&ldquo;the Company&rdquo;)
and its controlled entities (&ldquo;the Consolidated Entity&rdquo; or 
&ldquo;Group&rdquo;) for the year ended 30 June 2012 and
the state of its affairs at that time.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>DIRECTORS</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The names and details of the Directors
of the Company in office during the whole financial year and until the date of 
this report, unless noted otherwise, are:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Dr. Victor Rudenno</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Chairman &ndash; appointed 1 July 2011</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Dr. Rudenno was appointed as a Director
of the Company in April 2007. In 1984, Dr. Rudenno transitioned to the 
investment industry as a rated mining and energy analyst
working for firms such as James Capel, DBSM and Prudential Bache. In 1995, he 
moved to the corporate side of investment banking
and worked for a number of leading firms including Macintosh Corporate, Deutsche
Bank, Hartley Poynton and CIBC. In 2002, Dr. Rudenno
co-founded Equity Capital Markets Ltd, an investment bank specialising in 
corporate advice and capital raising which merged with
Interfinancial in 2005 and subsequently was acquired by Tolhurst, an ASX listed 
broker in 2007. He is currently an Executive Director
of Revaluate Pty Limited. He is a Senior Fellow of the Financial Services 
Institute of Australasia and a Fellow of the Australasian
Institute of Mining and Metallurgy. Dr. Rudenno holds a Bachelor of Mining 
Engineering degree, a Master of Commerce degree and
a Doctor of Philosophy for his thesis on Mining Economics. During his earlier 
academic career, Dr. Rudenno lectured both at the
University of New South Wales and part time at University of Sydney, 
predominantly on mining economics, geostatistics, operations
research and thermodynamics. He is the author of the textbook &ldquo;Mining 
Valuation Handbook&rdquo;.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Dr Rudenno is a member of the Audit Committee.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Dr Rudenno is a member of the Compensation
Committee.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">On 25 August 2010, Dr Rudenno was appointed
a non-executive Director of Pilbara Minerals Limited (a publicly listed company)
and continues to serve as a non-executive Director
through the date of this report.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Dr Rudenno has not held any directorships,
other than those disclosed above in the past three years.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Mr Terence Maxwell Barr </I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Managing Director</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Mr Barr is a petroleum geologist with over
30 years&rsquo; experience, including 11 years with Santos Limited. He is 
credited with the discovery of significant oil and gas
reserves during his career. In recent years, Mr Barr has specialised in tight 
gas exploration, drilling and completion and is considered
an expert in this field. This experience and expertise is invaluable given the 
exposure the Company has to tight gas opportunities
in Wyoming and other parts of United States of America. Mr Barr was appointed 
managing director of the Company on 25&nbsp;January&nbsp;2005.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Mr Barr has not held any other directorships
in the past three years.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Mr Keith Skipper</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Non Executive Director</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Mr. Skipper was appointed as director of
the Company on 15 September 2008.&nbsp; Mr. Skipper holds a B.Sc (Hons) degree 
in Geology from Reading University (United Kingdom)
and a Master of Science from McMaster University (Canada).&nbsp;&nbsp;He 
commenced&nbsp;his career with Amoco Canada Petroleum
Limited in 1970.&nbsp; Mr. Skipper&rsquo;s experience includes ten years with 
Bridge Oil Ltd and several years with Pan Canadian
Petroleum Limited (now part of Encana Corporation) and Antrim Energy 
Inc.&nbsp;in management and senior executive positions.&nbsp;He
is a resident of Australia.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Dr DeAnn Craig</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:
justify"><I>Non Executive Director &ndash; appointed
11 July 2011</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Dr Craig was appointed as a Director of
the Company on 11 July 2011.&nbsp; Dr Craig holds an Interdisciplinary PhD with 
emphasis in Petroleum Engineering and Operations
Research from the Colorado School of Mines (USA).&nbsp; She has also earned 
several degrees from Colorado School of Mines including
Masters of International Political Economy of Resources, Masters of Science 
Mineral Economics and Business and a Bachelor of Science
Chemical and Petroleum Refining Engineering.&nbsp; In addition Dr Craig holds an
MBA from Regis University in Denver, Colorado.
During her career Dr. Craig has been a drilling engineer, a reservoir engineer 
responsible for reserves determination and property
valuation, and progressed to senior management in several companies, including 
Phillips Petroleum, now ConocoPhillips, and CNX
Gas. She is a registered professional engineer in the state of Colorado.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">In the previous five years she has served
as Senior Vice President, Asset Assessment CNX Gas Corporation, served as an 
Adjunct Professor in the Petroleum Engineering Department
at the Colorado School of Mines and was appointed by the Governor of Colorado to
serve on the Colorado Oil and Gas Conservation
Commission.&nbsp; Currently she is consulting to the oil and gas industry.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Dr Craig is the Chair of the Audit Committee.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Dr Craig is a member of the Compensation
Committee.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Dr Craig was appointed a non-executive
Director of Atlas Resources Partners, L.P. in March 2012 and continues to serve 
in that position to the date of this report. Dr
Craig has not held any other directorships in the past three years.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Mr Rakich is an accountant and Company
Secretary with extensive corporate experience within the petroleum services, 
petroleum and mineral production and exploration industries.
Mr Rakich is responsible for the corporate management of Samson Oil &amp; Gas 
Limited and the maintenance of the Company&rsquo;s
ASX listing. He is a member of the Australian Society of Accountants and is 
currently Company Secretary for another public Company
in the resources sector.</P>

    <!-- Field: /Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>DIRECTORS&rsquo;
REPORT</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>30 June 2012 </B></P>
<!-- Field: Rule-Page --><DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="margin-top: 0; margin-
bottom: 0"><DIV STYLE="font-size: 1pt; border-top: Black 1pt solid; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</DIV></DIV><!-- Field: /Rule-Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The principal activities during the year
of entities within the Consolidated Entity were oil and gas exploration, 
development and production in the United States of America.
There have been no significant changes in the nature of these activities during 
the year.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company&rsquo;s focus in the future
will continue to be on oil and gas exploration, development and production in 
the USA. The Company will look to developing existing
acreage, whilst continuing to identify potential project acquisitions.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>OPERATING AND FINANCIAL REVIEW </B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Financial Results</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity made a gross profit
of $3,329,021 (2011: $2,624,678) from continuing operations for the financial 
year ended 30 June 2012.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The result for the financial year ended
30 June 2012 from continuing operations, after provision for income tax was a 
loss attributable to members of the parent of ($31,071,439)
(2011: profit $45,770,082). Included in the current year result is exploration 
expenditure expensed of $30,523,923 (2011: $403,826).
This has been expensed in line with the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s accounting 
policy to expense all exploration expenditure until
such time as it is expected that the future economic benefit will flow from the 
expenditure.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Development Activities</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Bakken Field, Williams County, North
Dakota</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Everett #1-15H</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">In June 2011, we successfully drilled our
sixth Mississippian Bakken well in the North Stockyard field in Williams County,
North Dakota, the Everett 1-15H (26% working interest).&nbsp;&nbsp;This
well underwent fracture stimulation in November 2011. This well had an initial 
production rate of 1,176 barrels of oil equivalent
per day (&ldquo;BOEPD&rdquo;).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Exploration Activities</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Hawk Springs, Goshen County, Wyoming</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><FONT 
STYLE="font-size: 10pt">During the year, Halliburton Energy
Services drilled the Defender US 33 #2-29H in the Hawk Springs Project in Goshen
County, Wyoming. The Company was carried on this
well up to the point of production of oil. This well commenced production in 
February 2012. Numerous operational and pumping issues
have been associated with this well. This well was cleaned out in July 2012 and 
has resumed pumping. The well is currently producing
approximately 75 barrels of oil per day with the pump jack speed set on a low 
setting (approximately 4.25 strokes per minute).
</FONT> <FONT STYLE="font-size: 10pt">Over the next few months the evaluation 
will continue and a decision made if it is appropriate
to increase the pump speed. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">During the year the Company drilled and
completed the Spirit of America US34 #1-29. The Spirit of America US34 #1-29 
well was unsuccessful in reaching the Lower Permian
and Pennsylvanian targets due to getting stuck in the Upper Permian Goose Egg 
Salt section. $4.9 million was expensed in relation
to this well and has been included in the exploration and evaluation expenditure
in the Statement of Comprehensive Income. Subsequent
to year end, the well has been permitted as a salt water disposal well.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Spirit of America replacement well,
Spirit of America US34 #2-29, was successfully drilled to a total depth of 
10,634 feet using a conservative drilling approach to
penetrate the troublesome salt section along with heavy weight, oil based mud. 
The interpreted net pay intervals will be fracture
stimulated in three stages. The initial frac will stimulate the lower 
perforations at around 10,000 feet, comprising 31 feet of
log pay. The second stage at around 9,300 feet will stimulate a single 7 feet of
log pay and the third stage at around 9,200 feet
will stimulate several sandstones with 23 feet of log pay. During the initial 
frac, 47,560 pounds of proppant was pumped and the
well was then flowed back for approximately 14 hours with the recovery of 27% of
the fluid pumped. The potential problems with
moving the bridge plug during the preparations to pump stage 2 were encountered,
with the tubing becoming stuck by frac sand, which
required a recovery operation.<FONT STYLE="color: red"> </FONT>The majority of 
this tubing was recovered and the well is currently
awaiting the completion of the final two frac stages.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 43%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
<TD STYLE="width: 57%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 6; Value: 1 -->
    <DIV STYLE="margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: right; width: 
100%">Page <!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->4<!-- Field: 
/Sequence --> of 79</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 
12pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>DIRECTORS&rsquo;
REPORT</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>30 June 2012 </B></P>
<!-- Field: Rule-Page --><DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="margin-top: 0; margin-
bottom: 0"><DIV STYLE="font-size: 1pt; border-top: Black 1pt solid; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</DIV></DIV><!-- Field: /Rule-Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Roosevelt Project, Roosevelt County,
Montana</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Samson&rsquo;s first appraisal (exploratory)
well in this project area was drilled in December 2011, Australia II. This well 
was drilled to a total measured depth of 14,972
feet with the horizontal lateral remaining within the target zone for the entire
lateral length. Oil and gas shows were returned
during the drilling of this well. Approximately 3,425 barrels of oil have been 
produced from this well. It is currently shut in
awaiting mechanical repairs.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Samson&rsquo;s second appraisal (exploratory)
well, Gretel II was drilled in January 2012 and fracture stimulated in March 
2012. It appears that this well was drilled on the
north side of the Brockton Fault zone, which is believed to be the western edge 
of the continuous Bakken oil. This well is currently
shut in as it was producing mostly water with a 5% oil cut.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">While both wells have delivered a negative
result, geological and operational information has been gained from these 
results which has added value to the Roosevelt project
as a whole going forward.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">In addition, during the year, Continental
Resources successfully drilled the Abercrombie 1-10H well, which Samson has 
approximately 0.07% working interest in. The bottom
hole location of this well is less than 3 kilometres from the bottom hole 
location of Samson&rsquo;s Gretel II well. Continental
have permitted several more drilling locations just to the south of 
Samson&rsquo;s Roosevelt Project. Samson has permitted the
Prairie Falcon well to be drilled to the south of the Brockton Fault line.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Samson has expensed $24.7 million in previously
capitalised exploration costs in relation to this project as a result of the 
results seen in the Gretel II and Australia II wells.
$7.3 million remains capitalised in regard to this project for land costs. 
Activities are continuing in this area and will continue
during the year.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><B>Production
Activities</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">During the 
year the Consolidated Entity produced approximately
87,956 (2011: 64,405) barrels of oil and 214,463 (2011: 423,077) Mcf of gas.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Reserves</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company has determined its hydrocarbon
reserves (as defined in the ASX listing rules) at an effective date of 1 July 
2012 to be as follows:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:

field in North Dakota.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:

curve as at 30 June 2012 less an appropriate differential to take into account 
the difference between the NYMEX pricing and the
price received by the Company at its various sales points.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">No dividend was paid or recommended for
payment during the year (2011: $Nil).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>DIRECTORS&rsquo;
REPORT</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>30 June 2012 </B></P>
<!-- Field: Rule-Page --><DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="margin-top: 0; margin-
bottom: 0"><DIV STYLE="font-size: 1pt; border-top: Black 1pt solid; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</DIV></DIV><!-- Field: /Rule-Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>SHARE OPTIONS</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">As at the date of this report, there were
278,496,315 (2011: 320,665,565) unissued ordinary shares under option. All 
option exercise prices are denominated in Australian
Dollars unless noted otherwise.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">4,000,000 options were granted on 11 October
2007 to key management personnel. These options have an exercise price of 30 
cents per share, an expiry date of 10 October 2012
and vested immediately.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">2,000,000 options were granted on 12 May
2008 to key management personnel. These options have an exercise price of 25 
cents per share and an expiry date of 11 May 2013.
600,000 options vested immediately, 600,000 vested following twelve months of 
service by the employee on 1 April 2009, and the
remainder vested on 1 April 2010, following 24 months of employment service.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">3,379,077 options were granted on 10 October
2007 to participants of a capital raising, completed at the same time. These 
options have an exercise price of 30 cents per share,
an expiry date of 10 October 2012 and vested immediately.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">344,431,144 options were granted on 6 November
2009, in conjunction with the rights offering completed at that time. An 
additional 12,500,007 options with the same terms and
conditions were issued in January 2010. The options have an exercise price of 
1.5 cents per share, an expiry date of 31 December
2012 and vested immediately. 109,144,663 of these options have been exercised to
the date of this report.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:
justify">29,000,000 options were granted on 18 November
2010 to the Directors of the Company. These options have an exercise price of 8 
cents per share and an expiry date of 31 October
2014. They vested immediately.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">32,000,000 options were granted on 17 December
2010 to employees of the Company. These options have an exercise price of 8 
cents per share and an expiry date of 31 December 2014.
One third of these options vested upon grant, another third vested on 31 January
2012, with the remainder vesting on 31 January
2013, provided the employee is still employed with the Company on the final 
vesting date. 500,000 of the vested options were exercised
in April 2011.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">4,000,000 options were granted on 1 July
2011 to an employee of the Company. These options have an exercise price 16.4 
cents and an expiry date of 31 December 2014. One
third of these options vested on 31 July 2011, another third vested on 31 July 
2012 with the remainder vesting on 31 July 2013,
provided the employee is still employed with the Company on the final vesting 
date.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">4,000,000 options were granted on 29 November
2011 to a non-executive Director of the Company. These options have an exercise 
price of 15.5 cents and an expiry date of 31 October
2015. They vested immediately.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Option holders do not have any right, by
virtue of the option, to participate in any share issue of the Company.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Shares issued as a result of the exercise
of options</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">62,916,630 1.5 cent options have been exercised
from 1 July 2011 to the date of this report.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B>Remuneration Report</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">The
remuneration report is set out under the following headings:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-
align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 0in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in; text-align: left">A</TD><TD
STYLE="text-align: justify">Principles used to determine the nature and amount 
of
remuneration</TD>
</TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-
align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 0in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in; text-align: left">B</TD><TD
STYLE="text-align: justify">Details of remuneration</TD>
</TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-
align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 0in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in; text-align: left">C</TD><TD
STYLE="text-align: justify">Service agreements</TD>
</TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-
align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 0in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in; text-align: left">D</TD><TD
STYLE="text-align: justify">Company performance</TD>
</TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">The 
information provided in this remuneration report has been
audited as required by section 308 (3C) of the <I>Corporations Act 2001.</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">

    <TD STYLE="width: 43%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 57%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>DIRECTORS&rsquo;
REPORT</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>30 June 2012 </B></P>
<!-- Field: Rule-Page --><DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="margin-top: 0; margin-
bottom: 0"><DIV STYLE="font-size: 1pt; border-top: Black 1pt solid; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</DIV></DIV><!-- Field: /Rule-Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><B><I>A 
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#9;Principles used to determine
the nature and amount
of remuneration</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The objective of the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s
executive reward framework is to ensure reward for performance is competitive 
and appropriate for the results delivered. The performance
of the Company depends upon the quality of its Directors and executives. To be 
successful and maximise shareholder wealth, the
Company must attract, motivate and retain highly skilled Directors and 
executives.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Remuneration packages applicable to the
executive Directors, senior executives and non-executive Directors are 
established with due regard to:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Performance against set 
goals</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Ability to attract and retain
qualified
and experienced Directors and senior executives.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">During the year, the Company formed a Compensation
Committee. Dr DeAnn Craig, Dr Victor Rudenno and Mr Keith Skipper are the 
current members of the Compensation Committee. The Compensation
Committee is responsible for determining and reviewing compensation arrangements
for Directors and executives. The Committee assesses
the appropriateness of the nature and amount of remuneration of Directors and 
executives on a periodic basis by reference to relevant
employment market conditions with the overall objective of ensuring maximum 
stakeholder benefit from the retention of a high quality
Board and executive team.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B><I>Non-executive Director Remuneration</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Fees and payments to non-executive Directors
reflect the demands which are made on, and the responsibilities of, the 
Directors. Non-executive Directors&rsquo; fees and payments
are reviewed annually by the board. The Chair&rsquo;s fees are determined 
independently of the other non-executive Directors. The
Chair is not present at any discussions relating to determination of his own 
remuneration.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The ASX Listing Rules specify that the
aggregate remuneration of non-executive Directors shall be determined from time 
to time by a general meeting. An amount not exceeding
the amount determined is then divided between Directors as agreed. The latest 
determination was at the Annual General Meeting held
on 18 November 2010 when shareholders approved an aggregate remuneration of 
A$500,000 per annum. The amount of aggregate remuneration
sought to be approved by shareholders and the manner in which it is apportioned 
amongst Directors is reviewed annually.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Non-executive Directors are encouraged
by the Board to hold shares in the Company (purchased by Directors on market). 
It is considered good governance for Directors to
have a stake in the Company on whose Board they sit.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Remuneration Incentives </I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company does not have a policy in place
limiting the Directors exposure to risk in relation to the Company&rsquo;s 
options.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The remuneration of non-executive Directors
for the year ended 30 June 2012 and 2011 is detailed in Table 1 and Table 2 of 
this report.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B><I>Executive Remuneration </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company aims to reward executives with
a level and mix of remuneration commensurate with their position and 
responsibilities within the Company and so as to:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Align the interests of 
executives with
those of shareholders;</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Link reward with strategic 
goals and performance
of the Company; and</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Ensure total remuneration is 
competitive
by market standards.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Base pay for executives is reviewed on
the contract renewal date to ensure the base pay is set to reflect the market 
for a comparable role. There are no guaranteed base
pay increases included in any executives&rsquo; contracts.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 43%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 57%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 9; Value: 1 -->
    <DIV STYLE="margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: right; width: 
100%">Page <!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->7<!-- Field: 
/Sequence --> of 79</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 
12pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>DIRECTORS&rsquo;
REPORT</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>30 June 2012 </B></P>
<!-- Field: Rule-Page --><DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="margin-top: 0; margin-
bottom: 0"><DIV STYLE="font-size: 1pt; border-top: Black 1pt solid; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</DIV></DIV><!-- Field: /Rule-Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Remuneration consists of fixed remuneration
and remuneration incentives in the form of options issued in the Company.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The level of fixed remuneration is reviewed
annually by the Board having due regard to performance against goals set for the
year and relevant comparative information. The
Board has access to external advice independent of management if required. 
During the year ended 30 June 2012 the Board sought
advice from Mercer (USA) Inc in regards to the remuneration, including long term
incentives for employees, of the Consolidated
Entity. The cost of this advice was approximately $50,000.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Remuneration Incentives</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Directors&rsquo; remuneration is not linked
to either long term or short term incentives. The Board feels that the expiry 
date and exercise price of the options issued to
the Directors in the current and prior years are sufficient to align the goals 
of the Directors and executives with those of the
shareholders to maximise shareholder wealth. There are no performance criteria 
or service conditions attached to options issued
to Directors.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">During the prior year, the Board agreed
that vesting conditions should be included in relation to the options issued to 
new executives. Previously, similar to the Directors
incentives detailed above, no conditions were placed on options issued to 
executives.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0in">A bonus structure was
in place for the calendar year 2011 for all employees. The bonus was payable 
dependent on the movement in the volume weighted average
share price (from trades on the Australian Securities Exchange and NYSE Mkt, 
adjusted for the impact of foreign exchange) from
December 2010 compared to December 2011. No bonus was payable if the share price
decreased from December 2011 or did not increase
above 25%. The maximum bonus was payable if the share price increased by 100% 
from December 2010 to December 2011. A total bonus
<FONT STYLE="color: windowtext">of $1,353,170</FONT> was payable if the combined
volume weighted average share price during December
2012, as calculated on individual trades across both exchanges was greater than 
100% of 6.3 cents (AUD). This was the volume weighted
average price calculated in December 2010 based on individual trades on the ASX 
and NYSE Amex. The values of trades on the NYSE
Amex were translated to AUD based on the exchange rate on each trading day in 
December from the Reserve Bank of Australia website.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">A bonus of $802,942 was paid in relation
to this incentive, $390,000 of which was accrued during the year ended 30 June 
2011.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">A new bonus arrangement was put in place
for the period 1 January 2012 to 30 June 2012. Bonuses will be earned by meeting
the thresholds set by the Board for each of the
three performance criteria: share price growth, reserve growth and production 
growth. Each metric is treated individually. Additionally
the Bonus Pool will include a discretionary component available for award by the
Compensation Committee for performance by an individual
outside of the performance criteria. To achieve the Bonus Pool in totality, the 
company has to meet the targeted thresholds for
all three criteria. The Bonus Plan for the current period also includes a set of
&ldquo;Stretch Targets&rdquo;, which would reward
the achievement of extraordinary results for Samson shareholders.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The weighting of each of these metrics
and the discretionary component for the six months ended 30 June 2012 is shown 
in the table below:</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="border-collapse: collapse; width: 
100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt

    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: center; border-bottom:

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Although none of the thresholds were met
a portion of the discretionary component of the bonus was awarded in recognition
of the efforts by all employees throughout the
period. $133,168 has been accrued during the current period. The maximum payable
under the discretionary component was $218,938.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">A bonus plan has not been put in place
for periods post 1 July 2012 as at the date of this report.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">

right"><B>DIRECTORS&rsquo;
REPORT</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>30 June 2012 </B></P>
<!-- Field: Rule-Page --><DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="margin-top: 0; margin-
bottom: 0"><DIV STYLE="font-size: 1pt; border-top: Black 1pt solid; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</DIV></DIV><!-- Field: /Rule-Page -->

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"><B><I>B</I></B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B><I>Details of 
Remuneration</I></B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Amounts of remuneration</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Details of remuneration of the Directors
and executives of the Company and Consolidated Entity in accordance with the 
requirements of the <I>Corporations Act 2001</I> and
its Regulations are set out in the following tables.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">For the purposes of this report, Key Management
Personnel (KMP) of the Consolidated Entity are defined as those persons having 
authority and responsibility for planning, directing
and controlling the major activities of the Company and the Consolidated Entity,
directly or indirectly, including any director
(whether executive or otherwise) of the Parent Company.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">For the purposes of this report, the term
&ldquo;executive&rdquo; encompasses the Chief Executive Officer, Company 
Secretary, Chief Financial Officer, Vice President &ndash;
Exploration and Vice President - Engineering. There are no further employees 
employed by either the Company or its subsidiaries
who meet the definition of executive, therefore only the five executives 
detailed above are included in this report. During the
year and as at the date of this report, unless stated otherwise, the key 
management personnel were:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">

justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">* This expense relates to the amount of
bonus paid for the period from 1 January 2011 to 31 December 2011 that was not 
accrued at 30 June 2011.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">**This expense relates to the current year
bonus expense for the bonus period from 1 January 2012 to 30 June 2012, which 
has been approved by the Board and is expected to
be paid by the end of September 2012.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><SUP>1 </SUP>These options were issued
during the year ended 30 June 2011; however are subject to a vesting schedule 
dependent on each employee&rsquo;s continued employment
with the Company. This value represents the portion of the expense recognised 
during the current year.</P>

justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">* This expense relates to the current year
expense associated with the calendar year 2011 bonus plan. Based on probability 
analysis, using Monte Carlo simulation, 60% of
the total bonus is expected to be paid out. This expense represents the accrual 
from 1 January 2011 to 30 June 2011. No cash has
been paid in relation to this bonus.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><SUP>1 </SUP>These options were issued
during the year ended 30 June 2011; however are subject to a vesting schedule 
dependent on each employee&rsquo;s continued employment
with the Company. This value represents the portion of the expense recognised 
during the current year.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><SUP>2 </SUP>Mr Gralla
was appointed Vice President &ndash; Engineering, effective 1 January 2011. 
Prior to that he was working for the Company on a contract
basis. Whitehall Engineering (an entity he controlled) was paid $158,952 for his
services, including a bonus of $42,500.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>

    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 
12pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width:

    <!-- Field: /Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>DIRECTORS&rsquo; REPORT</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right">for the year ended 30 June 2012</P>
<!-- Field: Rule-Page --><DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="margin-top: 0; margin-
bottom: 0"><DIV STYLE="font-size: 1pt; border-top: Black 1pt solid; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</DIV></DIV><!-- Field: /Rule-Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">500,000 remuneration options were exercised
during the prior year. The company received cash of A$40,000/US$42,216 in 
relation to this exercise.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B><I>C&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Serv
ice Agreements</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">It is the Board&rsquo;s policy that employment
contracts are only entered into with the managing director and senior
executives. As such contracts have been entered into for
Mr. Barr, Mr. Gralla, Mr. Ninke and Ms. Lamont. Details of these contracts are 
included below.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Mr. Barr &ndash; Chief Executive Officer</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Effective 1 January 2011, Mr Barr has been
retained by the Company to act as the Company&rsquo;s President, Managing 
Director and Chief Executive officer for a period of
three years with an option to extend the contract for an additional three years.
As of 1 January 2012, the contract allows for
total compensation of $454,700 (cash and non cash benefits) with a bonus payable
of up to $525,000 for the six months ended 30
June 2012 based on the Company&rsquo;s meeting certain performance metrics as 
detailed above. $46,820 has been accrued for six
months from 1 January 2012 to 30 June 2012. The bonus structure for the 
remaining years of the contract has not yet been set but
provision has been made in the contract for a bonus to be payable.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Mr. Ninke &ndash; Vice President Exploration</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Effective 1 January 2011, Mr Ninke has
been retained by the Company to act as Vice President - Exploration for a period
of three years with an option to extend the contract
for an additional three years. As of 1 January 2012, the contract allows for 
total compensation of $301,417 (cash and non cash
benefits) with a bonus payable of up to $221,374 for the six months ended 30 
June 2012 based on the Company&rsquo;s meeting certain
performance metrics as detailed above. $21,473 has been accrued for six months 
from 1 January 2012 to 30 June 2012. The bonus structure
for the remaining years of the contract has not yet been set but provision has 
been made in the contract for a bonus to be payable.
Mr Ninke also retains the right to receive a 1% revenue royalty from production 
from prospects identified and recommended prior
to 31 March 2011, being the Diamondback prospect. This prospect has yet to be 
drilled.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Ms. Lamont &ndash; Chief Financial Officer</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Effective 1 January 2011, Ms Lamont has
been retained by the Company to act as the Vice President &ndash; Finance and 
Chief Financial Officer for a period of three years
with an option to extend the contract for an additional three years. As of 1 
January 2012, the contract allows for total compensation
of $266,700 (cash and non cash benefits) with a bonus payable of up to $193,600 
for the six months ended 30 June 2012 based on
the Company&rsquo;s meeting certain performance metrics as detailed above. 
$18,779 has been accrued for six months from 1 January
2012 to 30 June 2012. The bonus structure for the remaining years of the
contract has not yet been set but provision has been made
in the contract for a bonus to be payable.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Mr. Gralla &ndash; Vice President Engineering</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Effective 1 January 2011, Mr Gralla has
been retained by the Company to act as the Vice President &ndash; Engineering 
for a period of three years with an option to extend
the contract for an additional three years. As of 1 January 2012, the contract 
allows for total compensation of $290,000 (cash
and non cash benefits) with a bonus payable of up to $212,240 for the six months
ended 30 June 2012 based on the Company&rsquo;s
meeting certain performance metrics as detailed above. $19,102 has been accrued 
for six months from 1 January 2012 to 30 June 2012.
The bonus structure for the remaining years of the contract has not yet been set
but provision has been made in the contract for
a bonus to be payable.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B><I>D&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Comp
any Performance</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company&rsquo;s performance is reflected
in the movement in the Company&rsquo;s earnings/(loss) per share (EPS) over 
time. The graph below shows Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited&rsquo;s
basic EPS history for the past five years, including the current period as well 
as the average share price quoted from the ASX.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">EPS for the years ended 30 June 2012, 2011,
2010, 2009 and 2008 has been measured based on the net (loss)/profit as 
calculated by the application of Australian Accounting
Standards.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 43%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 57%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 15; Value: 1 -->
    <DIV STYLE="margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt

right"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>DIRECTORS&rsquo; REPORT</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right">for the year ended 30 June 2012</P>
<!-- Field: Rule-Page --><DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="margin-top: 0; margin-
bottom: 0"><DIV STYLE="font-size: 1pt; border-top: Black 1pt solid; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</DIV></DIV><!-- Field: /Rule-Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><IMG SRC="chart.jpg" ALT="Z:\TQData\VINEYARD\Live Jobs\2012\09 Sep\14 
Sep\Shift III\Samson Oil & Gas\Draft\03-Production"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>CORPORATE STRUCTURE</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited is a Company
limited by shares that is incorporated and domiciled in Australia.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>EMPLOYEES</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity employed 13 employees
at 30 June 2012 (2011: 8 employees).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>LIKELY DEVELOPMENTS AND EXPECTED RESULTS</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The likely developments of the Consolidated
Entity during the next financial year involve the ongoing principal activities 
of oil and gas exploration, development and production
in the United States of America.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity plans to pursue
three objectives.</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in">1)</TD><TD STYLE="text-
align: justify">The appraisal and development of acreage in the Hawks Springs 
Project, Goshen County, Wyoming</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in">2)</TD><TD STYLE="text-
align: justify">The appraisal and development of acreage in the Roosevelt 
Project, Roosevelt County, Montana and</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in">3)</TD><TD STYLE="text-
align: justify">The continued production of the Company&rsquo;s North Stockyard 
Bakken Formation project.</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>SIGNIFICANT CHANGES IN THE STATE OF
AFFAIRS </B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Other than the changes mentioned above
in the operating review or below in significant events after balance date, there
has not been any matter or circumstance that has
occurred during the year or that has arisen since the end of the financial year 
that has significantly affected, or may significantly
affect:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">the operations; 
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">the results of those 
operations; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT

the Consolidated
Entity in subsequent financial years.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 21.35pt; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS AND PERFORMANCE</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity has various permits
and licenses to operate in different states within the United States of 
America.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">There have been no significant known breaches
of the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s licence or permit conditions during the year 
ended 30 June 2012.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
