<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>INDEMNIFICATION AND INSURANCE OF DIRECTORS</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">During the financial year, the Consolidated
Entity incurred a premium of $102,000 (2011: $85,000) to insure Directors and
officers of the Consolidated Entity.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The liabilities insured include costs and
expenses that may be incurred in defending civil or criminal proceedings that 
may be brought against the officers in their capacity
as officers of the Consolidated Entity, and any other payments arising from 
liabilities incurred by the officers in connection
with such proceedings. This does not include such liabilities that arise from 
conduct involving a wilful breach of duty by the
officers or the improper use by the officers of their position or of any 
information to gain advantage for themselves or someone
else or to cause detriment to the Company. It is not possible to apportion the 
premium between amounts relating to insurance against
legal costs and those relating to other liabilities.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>CORPORATE GOVERNANCE</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Directors of Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited
aspire to maintain the standards of corporate governance appropriate to the size
of the Company. The Company&rsquo;s corporate
governance statement is contained within the next section of this report.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>AUDIT COMMITTEE</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The members of the Audit Committee during
the year were Dr. Victor Rudenno, Dr. DeAnn Craig and Mr. Keith Skipper.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">See detail under Directors Meetings for
details of Audit Committee meetings attended by the Directors.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>SIGNIFICANT EVENTS AFTER THE BALANCE
DATE</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">In August 2012, the Company executed a
definative agreement to participate in the exploration of an area within the 
Williston Basin in North Dakota. Pursuant to this
agreement we acquired a 25% working interest in 23,700 acres (net 5,925 acres) 
at a price of $266 per acre. A payment of $1.58
million was made following the normal due diligence process, also in August 
2012. The exploration opportunity is a conventional
oil project that is adjacent to existing production from Mississipian aged 
reservoirs.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Except for the above, no other matter or
circumstance has arisen since 30 June 2012 that has significantly affected, or 
may significantly affect:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">the Consolidated 
Entity&rsquo;s operations
in future financial years; or </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 39.35pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.25in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New

<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">the results of those 
operations in future
financial years; or</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">the Consolidated 
Entity&rsquo;s state
of affairs in future financial years.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>NON-AUDIT SERVICES</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company may decide to employ the auditor
on assignments additional to their statutory audit duties where the 
auditor&rsquo;s expertise and experience with the Company are
important.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Directors when considering the auditor
for non audit services, will ensure that they are satisfied the provision of 
non-audit services is compatible with the general
standard of independence for auditors imposed by the <I>Corporations Act 
2001</I>. The nature and scope of each type of non-audit
service provided did not compromise auditor independence.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The board of Directors has considered the
position and, in accordance with advice received from the Audit Committee, is 
satisfied that the provision of non-audit services
is not incompatible with the general standard of independence for auditors 
imposed by the <I>Corporations Act 2001. </I>The Directors
are satisfied that the provision of non-audit services by the auditor, as set 
out below, did not compromise the auditor independence
requirements of the <I>Corporations Act 2001 </I>for the following reasons:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">all non-audit services have 
been reviewed
by the Audit Committee to ensure they do not impact the impartiality and 
objectivity of the auditor</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">none of the services 
undermine the general
principles relating to auditor independence as set out in APES 110 <I>Code of 
Ethics for Professional Accountants</I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">For the year ended 30 June 2012, PricewaterhouseCoopers
received or were due to receive the following amounts for the provision of non-
audit services:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 24pt; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 24pt; 
text-align: justify">Agreed-upon procedures&#9;$6,000&#9;
(2011: $nil)</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>AUDITOR INDEPENDENCE</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">A copy of the auditor&rsquo;s independence
declaration as required under section 307C of the <I>Corporations Act 2001</I> 
is set out on page 17.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Signed in accordance with a resolution
of the Board of Directors.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>

&amp; Gas Limited for the year ended 30 June 2012,1<B> </B>declare that to the 
best of my knowledge and belief, there have
been:</P>

54.7pt">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right"><B>CORPORATE GOVERNANCE STATEMENT</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
right; border-bottom: Black 0.5pt solid">for the
year ended 30 June 2012</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>CORPORATE GOVERNANCE STANDARD</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited (&ldquo;the
Company&rdquo;) and the board are committed to achieving and demonstrating the 
highest standards of Corporate Governance. The Board
continues to review the framework and practices to ensure they meet the 
interests of shareholders. The Company and its controlled
entity together are referred to as the Consolidated Entity in this 
statement.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">A description of the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s
main corporate governance practice is set out below. All these practices, unless
stated otherwise, were in place for the entire
year. They comply with the August 2007 ASX <I>Principles of Good Corporate 
Governance and Best Practice Recommendations.</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Principle 1 &ndash; Lay solid foundations
for management and oversight.</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The relationship between the board and
senior management is critical to the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s long term
success. The Directors are responsible to the shareholders
for the performance of the Consolidated Entity in both the short and longer term
and seek to balance often competing objectives
in the best interests of the Consolidated Entity as a whole. Their focus is to 
enhance the interests of the shareholders and other
key stakeholders and to ensure the Consolidated Entity is properly managed.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The responsibilities of the Board include:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">contributing to developing and approving
the corporate strategy;</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">reviewing and approving business plans,
the annual budget and financial plans including available resources and major 
capital expenditure initiatives;</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">overseeing and 
monitoring</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">organisational performance 
and the achievement
of the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s strategic goals and 
objectives</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">compliance with 
Company&rsquo;s code of
conduct</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">progress of major capital 
expenditures
and other significant corporate projects including acquisitions and 
divestitures</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">ensuring there are effective management
processes in place and approving major corporate 
initiatives</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">overseeing the operation of the 
Company&rsquo;s
system for compliance and risk management </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">monitoring financial performance 
including
the approval of the annual and half year financial reports and liaison with the 
Company&rsquo;s auditors</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">appointment, performance assessment and,
if necessary, removal of the Managing Director</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">ensuring appropriate resources are 
available
to senior management.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Day to day management of the Company&rsquo;s
affairs and the implementation of the corporate strategy and policy initiatives 
are formally delegated by the Board to the Managing
Director and senior executives.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:
justify"><B>Principle 2 &ndash; Structure the Board
to add value</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The board operates in accordance with the
broad principles set out in its charter which is available from the corporate 
governance information section of the company&rsquo;s
website at www.samsonoilandgas.com. The charter details the board&rsquo;s 
composition and responsibilities.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Board composition</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The charter states:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">The board is to be comprised of both 
executive
and non-executive Directors with a majority of non-executive Directors. Non-
executive Directors bring a fresh perspective to the
board&rsquo;s consideration to strategic, risk and performance 
matters</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">In recognition of the importance of 
independent
views and the board&rsquo;s role in supervising the activities of management, 
the Chair must be independent of management and all
Directors are required to exercise independent judgement and review and 
constructively challenge the performance of management</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">The Chair is elected by the full board
and is required to meet regularly with the Managing 
Director</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">The Company is to maintain a mix of
Directors
on the board from different backgrounds with complementary skills and 
experience.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.25in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 43%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 57%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.25in">&nbsp;</P>
<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 20; Value: 1 -->
    <DIV STYLE="margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: right; width: 
100%">Page <!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->18<!-- Field: 
/Sequence --> of 79</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 
12pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: 
right">CORPORATE GOVERNANCE STATEMENT</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align:
right">for the year ended 30 June 2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The board seeks to ensure that:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">At any point in time, its membership 
represents
an appropriate balance between Directors with experience and knowledge of the 
Consolidated Entity and Directors with an external
or fresh perspective</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">The size of the board is conducive to
effective discussion and efficient decision-making.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Directors&rsquo; Independence</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The board has adopted specific principles
in relation to Directors&rsquo; independence. These state that when determining 
independence, a director must be a non-executive
and the board should consider whether the director:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Is a substantial shareholder of the 
Company
or an officer or, or otherwise associated directly with, a substantial 
shareholder of the Company</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Is or has been employed in an executive
capacity by the Company or any other Consolidated Entity member within three 
years before commencing to serve on the board</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Within the last year has been a principal
of a material professional adviser or material consultant to the Company or any 
other Consolidated Entity member, or an employee
materially associated with the service provided</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Is a material supplier or customer of
the Company or any other Consolidated Entity member, or an officer or otherwise 
associated directly or indirectly with a material
supplier or customer</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family:
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Has a material contractual relationship
with the Company or a controlled entity other than as director of the 
Consolidated Entity</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-family: 
Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Is free from any business or other 
relationship
which could, or could reasonably be perceived to, materially interfere with the 
director&rsquo;s independent exercise of their
judgement.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&ldquo;Materiality&rdquo; for these purposes
is determined on a qualitative basis. A transaction of any amount or a 
relationship is deemed material if knowledge of it may impact
the shareholders&rsquo; understanding of the director&rsquo;s performance.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Recent thinking on corporate governance
has introduced the view that a director&rsquo;s independence may be perceived to
be impacted by lengthy service on the board. To
avoid any potential concerns, the board has determined that a director will not 
be deemed independent if he or she has served on
the board of the Company for more than ten years. The board continues to monitor
developments on this issue.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The board assess independence each year.
To enable this process, the Directors must provide all information to the Chief 
Financial Officer that may be relevant to the assessment.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Board members</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Details of the members of the board, their
experience, expertise, qualifications, term of office and their independent 
status are set out in the Directors report under the
heading &ldquo;Directors&rdquo;. At the date of signing the Directors&rsquo; 
report, there is one executive director and three
non-executive Directors. All non-executive Directors are deemed to be 
independent.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:
justify"><I>Term of office</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company&rsquo;s Constitution specifies
that all non-executive Directors appointed during the year, automatically retire
at the next annual general meeting (&ldquo;AGM&rdquo;)
and are eligible for re-election at that general meeting. Any director that has 
been appointed during the year and is subject to
automatic retirement at the AGM is not taken into account in the automatic 
retirement of one third of the Directors as detail below.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">At each annual general meeting:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">(a) one third (or if that is
not a whole number, the whole number nearest to one third) of the Directors who 
are not:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-
align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in; text-align: 
left">(i)</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify">appointed, and required to retire,
as detailed above;
or</TD>
</TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-
align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in; text-align: 
left">(ii)</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify">the Managing Director; or</TD>
</TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-
align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in; text-align: 
left">(iii)</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify">Directors only because they are 
Alternates; and</TD>
</TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.25in">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 31.5pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -13.5pt">(b) any
Director who would, if that Director remained in office until the next annual 
general meeting, have held that office for more than
3 years must retire from office and is eligible for re-election.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 52%; padding-right: -4.1pt; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: 
bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 48%; padding-right: -4.1pt; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: 
bold; text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 21; Value: 1 -->
    <DIV STYLE="margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: right; width: 
100%">Page <!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->19<!-- Field: 
/Sequence --> of 79</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 
12pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: 
right">CORPORATE GOVERNANCE STATEMENT</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align:
right">for the year ended 30 June 2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Chair and Chief Executive Officer</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Chair is responsible for leading the
board, ensuring Directors are properly briefed in all matters relevant to their 
role and responsibilities, facilitating board discussions
and managing the board&rsquo;s relationship with the Company&rsquo;s senior 
executives. In accepting the position, the Chair has
acknowledged that it will require a significant time commitment and has 
confirmed that other positions would not hinder his effective
performance in the role of Chair.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The CEO is responsible for implementing
the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s strategies and policies. The board charter 
specifies that these are separate roles to be undertaken
by separate people. The CEO role is performed by the Managing Director.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Commitment</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The board held 21 meetings (including those
held by circulating resolution) during the year. The number of meetings of the 
Company&rsquo;s board of Directors and of each board
committee held during the year ended 30 June 2012, and the number of meetings 
attended by each director is disclosed on page 15.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">It is the Company&rsquo;s practice to allow
its executive Directors to accept appointments outside the Company with prior 
written approval of the board. No appointments of
this nature were requested during the year.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Prior to appointment or being submitted
for re-election, each non-executive director is required to specifically 
acknowledge that they will have and continue to have the
time available to discharge their responsibilities to the Company.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Independent professional advice</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Directors and board committees have the
right, in connection with their duties and responsibilities, to seek independent
professional advice at the Company&rsquo;s expense.
Prior written approval of the Chair is required, but this will not be 
unreasonably withheld.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Performance assessment</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">In order to ensure that the board continues
to discharge its responsibilities in an appropriate manner, the performance of 
all Directors is reviewed annually by the Chair.
Directors whose performance is unsatisfactory are asked to retire. The board has
not formally documented the results of performance
evaluations to date.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Board committees</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The board has established an Audit Committee
to assist in the execution of the supervision of the audit by the Board. 
Effective 28 July 2011, the Board also formed a Compensation
Committee to assist in the Board in its responsibility in relation to the 
compensation of the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s executive
officers and Directors.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Audit Committee</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Audit Committee consists entirely of
independent Directors, being Dr. DeAnn Craig, Mr. Keith Skipper and Dr. Victor 
Rudenno. The Audit Committee operates in accordance
with a formal written charter, a copy of which is available on the 
Company&rsquo;s website. This committee oversees, reviews and
acts on reports to the board on various auditing and accounting matters, selects
the independent auditors and oversees the scope
of annual audits, fees to be paid to the independent auditors, the performance 
of the independent auditors and our accounting practices.
In addition, the Audit Committee oversees the Company&rsquo;s compliance 
programs relating to legal and regulatory requirements.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">It is the board&rsquo;s responsibility
to ensure that an effective internal control framework exists within the entity.
This includes internal controls to deal with both
the effectiveness and efficiency of significant business processes. This also 
includes the safeguarding of assets, the maintenance
of proper accounting records, and the reliability of financial information.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Nomination Committee</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company does not have a formally appointed
Nomination Committee, as the Directors believe the size of the Company&rsquo;s 
operations does not warrant the establishment of
such a committee.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right:
-4.1pt; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 52%; padding-right: -4.1pt; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: 
bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 48%; padding-right: -4.1pt; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: 
bold; text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>

justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align:

    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align:

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Principle 3 &ndash; Promote ethical
and responsible decision making</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Code of Conduct</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company has developed a Code of Conduct
(&ldquo;the Code&rdquo;) which has been fully endorsed by the board and applies 
to all Directors and employees. The Code is regularly
reviewed and updated as necessary to ensure it reflects the highest standards of
behaviour and professionalism and the practices
necessary to maintain confidence in the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s integrity 
and to take into account legal obligations and reasonable
expectations of the Company&rsquo;s stakeholders.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">In summary, the Code requires that at all
times all Company personnel act with the utmost integrity, objectivity and in 
compliance with the letter and the spirit of the
law and Company policies.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The purchase and sale of Company securities
by Directors and employees is only permitted during non-black out periods. Black
out periods are defined in the Company&rsquo;s
Insider Trading Policy. Any transactions undertaken must be notified to the CEO 
or CFO prior to being entered into.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Code and the Company&rsquo;s trading
policy is discussed with each new employee. Further training is periodically 
provided and all employees are asked to sign an annual
declaration confirming their compliance with the Code and trading policy.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Code requires employees who are aware
of unethical practices with the Consolidated Entity or breaches of the 
Company&rsquo;s trading policy to report these using the
Company&rsquo;s whistleblower program.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Directors are satisfied that the Consolidated
Entity has complied with its policies on ethical standards, including trading in
securities.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">A copy of the Code and the Insider Trading
Policy are available on the Company&rsquo;s website.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Principle 4 &ndash; Safeguard integrity
in financial reporting</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Audit Committee</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:
justify">The Audit Committee consists of the following
non-executive Directors:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">D. Craig</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">K. Skipper</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">V. Rudenno</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Details of these Directors&rsquo; qualifications
and attendance at Audit Committee meetings are set out in the Directors report 
on pages 2, 3 and 15.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">All members of the Audit Committee are
financially literate and have an appropriate understanding of the oil and gas 
industry. Dr Rudenno is deemed to be the financial
expert.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Audit Committee operates in accordance
with a charter which is available on the Company&rsquo;s website. The main 
responsibilities of the committee are to:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">review, assess and approve 
the annual
report, Form 10K, the half-year financial report and all other financial 
information published by the Company or released to the
market</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">assist the board in reviewing
the effectiveness
of the organisation&rsquo;s internal control environment 
covering:</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.75in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">effectiveness and efficiency 
of operations</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.75in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">reliability of financial 
reporting</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.75in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">compliance with applicable 
laws and regulations</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">oversee the effective 
operation of the
risk management framework</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">recommend to the board the 
appointment,
removal and remuneration of the external auditors and review the terms of their 
engagement, the scope and quality of the audit
and assess performance</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">consider the independence and
competence
of the external auditor on an on-going basis</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">review and approve the level 
of non-audit
services provided by the external auditors and ensure it does not adversely 
impact on auditor independence</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Symbol; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; text-align: justify; text-
indent: -0.25in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right:

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 52%; padding-right: -4.1pt; font-size: 10pt; font-weight:

    <!-- Field: /Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Symbol; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; text-align: justify; text-

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: 
right">CORPORATE GOVERNANCE STATEMENT</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align:
right">for the year ended 30 June 2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Symbol; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; text-align: justify; text-
indent: -0.25in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">review and monitor related 
party transactions
and assess their propriety</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">report to the board on 
matters relevant
to the committee&rsquo;s role and responsibilities.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">In fulfilling its responsibilities, the
Audit Committee:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">receives regular reports from
management
and the external auditors</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">meets with external auditors 
at least
twice a year, or more frequently if necessary</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">reviews the processes the CEO
and CFO
have in place to support their certifications to the 
board</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">reviews any significant 
disagreements
between the auditors and management, irrespective of whether they have been 
resolved</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">is given the opportunity to 
meet with
external auditors without the presence of management if 
required</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">provides the external 
auditors with a
clear line of communication at any time to the either the audit committee or the
Chair of the board.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Audit Committee has authority, within
the scope of its responsibilities, to seek any information it requires from any 
employee or external party.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>External auditors</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company&rsquo;s and Audit Committee&rsquo;s
policy is to appoint external auditors who clearly demonstrate quality and 
independence. The performance of the external auditor
is reviewed annually and applications for tender of external audit services are 
requested as deemed appropriate, taking into consideration
assessment of performance, existing value and tender costs. The external audit 
was put to tender in 2008 with PricewaterhouseCoopers
being appointed external auditors in October 2008. It is PricewaterhouseCoopers 
policy to rotate audit engagement partners on listed
companies at least every five years.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">An analysis of fees paid to the external
auditors, including a break-down of fees for non-audit services, is provided in 
the Directors&rsquo; report and in note 22 to the
financial statements. It is the policy of the external auditors to provide an 
annual declaration of their independence to the Audit
Committee.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The external auditor will attend the annual
general meeting and be available to answer shareholder questions about the 
conduct of the audit and the preparation and content
of the audit report.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Principle 5 and 6 &ndash; Make timely
and balanced disclosures and respect the rights of shareholders</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company recognises the importance of
ensuring its continuous disclosure requirements are met, and has procedures in 
place to ensure this happens, however has not formally
documented them.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company Secretary has been nominated
as the person responsible for communications with the Australian Securities 
Exchange (&ldquo;ASX&rdquo;). This role includes responsibility
for ensuring compliance with the continuous disclosure requirements in the ASX 
Listing Rules and overseeing and co-ordinating information
disclosure to the ASX, analysts, brokers, shareholders, the media and the 
public.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">All information disclosed to the ASX is
posted on the Company&rsquo;s website as soon as it is disclosed to the ASX. 
When analysts are briefed on aspects of the Consolidated
Entity&rsquo;s operations, the material used in the presentation is released to 
the ASX and posted on the Company&rsquo;s website.
Procedures have also been established for reviewing whether any price sensitive 
information has been inadvertently disclosed and,
if so, this information is also immediately released to the market.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">From 30 June 2009, shareholders could elect
whether or not they wished to receive a hard copy of the Annual Report. A copy 
of the Annual Report is sent to all shareholders
who elected to receive one. All shareholders receive the Notice of Meeting for 
the Company&rsquo;s Annual General Meeting.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company actively promotes communication
with shareholders through a variety of measures, including the use of the 
Company&rsquo;s website and email. The Company&rsquo;s
reports and ASX announcements may be viewed and downloaded from its website: 
<FONT STYLE="color: windowtext"><U>www.samsonoilandgas.com
</U></FONT>or the ASX website: asx.com.au under ASX code &ldquo;SSN&rdquo;. The 
Company also maintains an email list for the distribution
of the Company&rsquo;s announcements via email in a timelier manner.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 52%; padding-right: -4.1pt; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: 
bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 48%; padding-right: -4.1pt; font-size: 10pt; font-weight:
bold; text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: 
right">CORPORATE GOVERNANCE STATEMENT</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; font-size: 10pt; text-align:
right">for the year ended 30 June 2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Principle 7- Recognise and manage risk</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The board, through the Audit Committee,
is responsible for ensuring there are adequate policies in relation to risk 
management, compliance and internal control systems.
In summary, the Company policies are designed to ensure strategic, operational, 
legal, reputational and financial risks are identified,
assessed, effectively and efficiently managed and monitored to enable 
achievement of the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s business objectives.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Considerable importance is placed on maintaining
a strong control environment. There is an organisation structure with clearly 
drawn lines of accountability and delegation of authority.
Adherence to the Code of Conduct is required at all times and the board actively
promotes a culture of quality and integrity. The
Company has an Enterprise Risk Policy though a formal Risk Management Committee 
has not been established. The Company believes
that the regular communication between senior management and the board ensures 
that risks are identified and dealt with, when appropriate,
in a timely manner.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Environmental Risk System</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company recognises the importance of
environmental risk management and is committed to the highest level of sound 
environmental management. The Company has established
best practice environmental policies for those fields that it operates and seeks
to ensure the operators of its non-operated properties
operate in an environmentally sound manner.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Corporate reporting</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Managing Director and CFO have made
the following certifications to the board:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">that the Company&rsquo;s 
financial reports
are complete and present a true and fair view, in all material respects, of the 
financial condition and operational results of
the Consolidated Entity and are in accordance with relevant Accounting 
Standards</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><FONT STYLE="font-
family: Symbol">&middot;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">that the above statement is 
founded on
a sound system of risk management and internal compliance and control which 
implements the policies adopted by the board and that
the Company&rsquo;s risk management and internal compliance and control is 
operating efficiently and effectively in all material
respects in relation to financial reporting risks.</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Principle 8 &ndash; Remunerate fairly
and responsibly</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">A Compensation Committee was formed on
28 July 2011. The Compensation Committee is responsible for determining and 
reviewing compensation arrangements for the Directors.
Further detail in relation to the Company&rsquo;s remuneration policies can be 
found in the Remuneration Report included within
the Directors&rsquo; Report.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Members of the senior executive team sign
a formal employment contract at the time of their appointment covering a range 
of matters including their duties, rights, responsibilities
and any entitlements on termination. The standard contract refers to a specific 
formal job description.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Further information on Directors&rsquo;
and executives&rsquo; remuneration, including principles used to determine 
remuneration, is set out in the Directors&rsquo; report
under the heading &ldquo;Remuneration report&rdquo;.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The board also assumes responsibility for
overseeing management succession planning.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 52%; padding-right: -4.1pt; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: 
bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 48%; padding-right: -4.1pt; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: 
bold; text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>

STYLE="padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left"><FONT STYLE="font-size:

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><I>The above 
statement of changes in equity should be read in
conjunction with the accompanying notes.</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:

    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">NOTES TO THE

    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: windowtext 1pt solid; text-align: right">for 30
