the equity method, and the choice to proportionately consolidate will no longer 
be permitted. Parties to a joint operation will
account their share of revenues, expenses, assets and liabilities in much the 
same way as under the previous standard. AASB 11
also provides guidance for parties that participate in joint arrangements but do
not share joint control. While the Consolidated
Entity does not expect the new standard to have a significant impact on its 
composition, it has yet to perform a detailed analysis
of the new guidance in the context of its various investees that may or may not 
be subject to joint arrangements under the new
rules.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify">AASB 12 sets out the required disclosures
for entities reporting under the two new standards, AASB 10 and AASB 11, and 
replaces the disclosure requirements currently found
in AASB 128. Application of this standard by the group will not affect any of 
the amounts recognised in the financial statements,
but will impact the type of information disclosed in relation to the group's 
investments.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 
0in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 59%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 0; 
font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 41%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 0; 
font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">2012 Annual 
Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 45; Value: 1 -->
    <DIV STYLE="margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: right; width: 
100%">Page <!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->43<!-- Field: 
/Sequence --> of 79</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 
12pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify"></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: 
right">NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid">for 30 June 2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify">AASB 127 is renamed <I>Separate
Financial Statements</I> and is now a standard dealing solely with separate 
financial statements. Application of this standard
by the Consolidated Entity will not affect any of the amounts recognised in the 
financial statements<I> </I>Amendments to AASB
128 provide clarification that an entity continues to apply the equity method 
and does not remeasure its retained interest as part
of ownership changes where a joint venture becomes an associate, and vice versa.
The amendments also introduce a &ldquo;partial
disposal&rdquo; concept. The Consolidated Entity is still assessing the impact 
of these amendments.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify">The Consolidated Entity does not
expect to adopt the new standards before their operative date. They would 
therefore be first applied in the financial statements
for the annual reporting period ending 30 June 2014.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 
0in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 59%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 0; 
font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 41%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 0; 
font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">2012 Annual 
Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top; text-align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 0%"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.75in; text-align: left"><B>NOTE 
3.</B></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>REVENUE AND EXPENSES</B></TD>
</TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="border-collapse: collapse; width: 
100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</TD><TD 
STYLE="font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD STYLE="text-align: left; padding-left: 12pt">Deferred income tax at 30 
June relates to the following:</TD><TD>&nbsp;</TD>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity has tax losses
carried forward arising in Australia of $9,553,496 (2011: $8,773,972). The 
benefit of these losses of $2,866,049 (2011: $2,632,192)
will only be obtained in future years if:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in">&nbsp;&nbsp;i.</TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify">the Consolidated Entity and the Parent Entity derive
future assessable income of a nature and an
amount sufficient to enable the benefit from the deduction for the losses to be 
realised; and</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in">&nbsp;ii.</TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify">the Consolidated Entity and the Parent Entity have 
complied and continue to comply with the conditions
for deductibility imposed by law; and</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in">iii.</TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify">no changes in tax legislation adversely affect the 
Consolidated Entity and the Parent Entity in
realising the benefit from deduction for the losses.</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity has Federal net
operating tax losses in the United States of approximately $17,674,196 (2011: 
$5,242,426). The current year loss has been carried
back against prior year profits and is approximately $12,431,770 (2011: 
$20,798,232). Future years are limited to an estimated
$403,194 per year as a result of a change in ownership of the one of the 
subsidiaries which occurred in January 2005. If not utilised,
the tax net operating losses will expire during the period from 2008 to 
2025.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">In addition to the above mentioned Federal
carried forward losses in the United States, the Company also has approximately 
$11,224,209 (2011: $6,598,099) of State carried
forward tax losses, with expiry dates between June 2010 and June 2030. A 
deferred income tax asset in relation to these losses
has not been recognised as realisation of the benefit is not regarded as 
probable.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The deferred tax benefit the Consolidated
Entity will ultimately realise is dependent both upon the loss recoupment 
legislation in the United States and taxable income at
the time recoupment.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity has recorded income
receivable from the Internal Revenue Service in the United States of $4,348,456 
(2011: $2,579,626).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity does not meet the
definition of a group for the purposes of applying tax consolidation.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 
0in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 59%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 0; 
font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 41%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 0; 
font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">2012 Annual 
Report</TD></TR>

justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="border-collapse: collapse; width:

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</TD><TD 
STYLE="font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD COLSPAN="6" STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: center">Consolidated 
Entity</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: 
bold">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: center">2012</TD><TD

to interest rate risk is discussed in note 28. The maximum exposure to credit

of cash mentioned above.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:

text-align: justify">Information about the Consolidated

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New

<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 27pt">b)</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: 
justify">Fair value and credit risk &ndash; current 
receivables</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 27pt; 
text-align: justify">Due to the short-term nature of
these receivables, their carrying amount is assumed to approximate their fair 
value.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The maximum exposure to credit risk at
the reporting date is the carrying amount of each class of receivables mentioned
above. All receivables are unsecured. Refer to
note 28 for more information on the risk management policy of the Consolidated 
Entity and the credit quality of trade receivables.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent:

include:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="border-collapse: collapse; width:

    <TD STYLE="text-align: left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align:

    <TD STYLE="text-align: left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align:

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White">
    <TD STYLE="width: 74%; text-align: left">Prepaid drilling expenses</TD><TD 
STYLE="width: 1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 1%; text-align: left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="width: 10%;

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Prepaid drilling expenses include cash
advanced to the operators of the drilling operations in advance of the drilling 
commencing.</P>

left">&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The exploration expenditure capitalised
relates to the Company&rsquo;s acreage in the Hawk Springs Project, Goshen 
County, Wyoming and the Roosevelt Project, Roosevelt
County, Montana. Activity is continuing in both project areas. Expenditure 
written off relates to the costs associated with drilling
Australia II and Gretel II in the Roosevelt Project. The costs associated with 
both wells are unlikely to be recovered based on
current well results.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">$5 million in cost relating to the drilling
of the Spirit of America II well remains capitalised pending the completion of 
the fracture stimulation planned for this well.
The carrying value of this well be reviewed following analysis of the results of
this stimulation, expected sometime in the fourth
quarter of the 2012 calendar year.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The recoverability of the carrying value
of deferred exploration and evaluation expenditure is dependent on the 
successful exploitation, or alternatively sale, of the respective
areas of interest.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B></B></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: 
right">NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid">for 30 June 2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Impairment of oil and gas properties</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">At 30 June 2012, the Consolidated Entity
reviewed the carrying value of its oil and gas properties for impairment. An 
independent review by the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s
reserve engineers, Ryder Scott Company was performed to assess the recoverable 
amount based on the net present value of the Consolidated
Entity&rsquo;s assets (by cash generating unit). The discount rate used to 
assess the recoverable amount (based on the value in
use) was 10% (2011: 10%). The value in use has been based on the expected useful
lives of the respective fields. The effect of
future income taxes on discounted cashflows has not been considered in relation 
to the value of the current properties due the
entity&rsquo;s considerable tax losses and other tax deductions available to the
Consolidated Entity.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The value of oil and gas properties was
reviewed on a field by field basis and has resulted in net impairment expense of
$816,188 (2011:$25,643). $347,601 was related
to the Davis Bintliff property, in Brazoria county, Texas. This well is 
primarily a gas well and the decrease in its value is aligned
with the continued fall in the gas price. This well continues to perform 
well.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The remaining impairment expense relates
to the write off of the asset value associated with the asset retirement 
obligation recognised for new wells drilled during the
year &ndash; Australia II, Gretel II, Defender and Spirit of America I.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">It is the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s policy
to use proved and probable reserves to support the carrying value of its 
properties. During the half year ended 31 December 2010,
the Consolidated Entity recognised $6,678,940 in impairment expense in relation 
to its Jonah and Lookout Wash fields. These fields
were sold in March 2011, and this impairment has been included in discontinued 
operations.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-
align: justify">

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.75in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"><I>(i)</I></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><I>Trade payables are non-interest bearing and 
normally settled on 30 day terms.</I></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.75in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"><I>(ii)</I></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><I>In the prior year this accrual relates to the 
expense associated with the calendar year 2011
bonus plan. Based on probability analysis, using Monte Carlo simulation, 60% of 
the total bonus was expected to be paid out. This
expense represented the accrual from 1 January 2011 to 30 June 2011. A total of 
$802,942 was paid out in the current year in relation
to this bonus for the period 1 January 2011 to 31 December 2011. The accrual in 
the current year relates to the discretionary piece
of the bonus payable for the period 1 January 2012 to 30 June 2012. 
</I></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.75in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"><I>(iii)</I></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><I>Other payables include accruals for annual leave.
The entire obligation is presented as current,
since the Consolidated Entity does not have an unconditional right to defer 
settlement. Based on past experience, the Consolidated
Entity expects employees to take the full amount of accrued leave within the 
next twelve months.</I></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1.25in; 
text-align: justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in;

    <TD STYLE="text-align: left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align:

right">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: left">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White">
    <TD STYLE="width: 74%; text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt">Provision for 
Restoration</TD><TD STYLE="width: 1%; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 1%; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: 
left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="width: 10%; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-
align: right">1,279,211</TD><TD STYLE="width: 1%; padding-bottom: 1pt; text-
align: left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="width: 1%; padding-bottom: 1pt">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 1%; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: 
left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="width: 10%; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-
align: right">526,218</TD><TD STYLE="width: 1%; padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align:
left">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204,255,204)">
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; padding-bottom: 2.5pt">&nbsp;</TD><TD 
STYLE="font-weight: bold; padding-bottom: 2.5pt">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-weight: bold; text-align:
left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-weight: 
bold; text-align: right">1,279,211</TD><TD STYLE="padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-
weight: bold; text-align: left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; 
padding-bottom: 2.5pt">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-weight: bold; text-align:
left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-weight: 
bold; text-align: right">526,218</TD><TD STYLE="padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-
weight: bold; text-align: left">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">A provision for restoration is recognised
in relation to the oil and gas activities for costs such as reclamation, 
plugging wells and other costs associated with the restoration
of oil and gas properties. Estimates of the restoration obligations are based on
anticipated technology and legal requirements
and future costs, which have been discounted to their present value. In 
determining the restoration provision, the entity has assumed
no significant changes will occur in the relevant government legislation in 
relation to the restoration of such oil and gas properties
in the future.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 
0in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 59%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 0; 
font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 41%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 0; 
font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">2012 Annual 
Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: 
right">NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid">for 30 June 2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"><I>(i)</I></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><I>In June 2010 the Company completed a share 
purchase plan. All share applications were received
prior to 30 June 2010 though some funds were not received into the Consolidated 
Entity&rsquo;s bank account until post 30 June
2010. The shares were issued on 9 July 2010. The Company issued 205,189,880 
ordinary shares at A$ 3.4 cents per share/US$ 0.027
cents per share to raise US$5,817,133. </I></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify"><I>In June 2010 the Company placed
9,225,000 ordinary shares at $ 3.4 cents per share/US $ 2.8 cents per share to 
raise US$261,528. The funds were received prior
to year end however the shares were not issued until 9 July 2010.</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"><I>(ii)</I></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><I>During the course of the year the Company issued 
39,913,038 (2011: 70,554,301) ordinary shares
upon the exercise of 39,913,038 (2011: 70,554,301) options. 
</I></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify"><I>The exercise price of the options
exercised was (average price based on the exchange rate on the date of exercise)
A$0.015 per share/US$0.015 per share (2011: A$0.015
per share/US$0.015 per share) to raise US$632,101 (2011: US$1,055,812).</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify"><I>In the prior year the exercise
price of 500,000 of the options exercised was A$0.08 per share/US$0.084 per 
share (average price based on the exchange rate on
the date of exercise) to raise 2011: US$42,216. No 8 cent options were issued 
during the current year </I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
align: justify"><I>In the current year cash was
received in relation to the exercise of 500,000 options prior to year end 
however these shares were not issued until 4 July 2012.</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"><I>(iii)</I></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><I>During the year ended 30 June 2011, in 
conjunction with the reduction in salaries accepted by
all employees and Directors of the Company, the Company issued 6,580,021 shares 
to employees and Directors. These shares were valued
at the volume weighted average share price across the ASX and NYSE Amex for the 
period being compensated for being 1 October 2009
to 30 April 2010, being US$ 2.3 cents per share.</I></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"><I>(iv)</I></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><I>These shares were issued to Kestrel shareholders 
throughout 2008 as part of the offer to non-US
resident shareholders whereby they received five Samson shares for every one 
Kestrel share held. The Samson share price on the
date the acceptance of the offer was received was deemed to be the fair value of
the share. As at balance date acceptances had
been received for 65,000 (2011:65,000) shares which have not yet been issued. 
These shares will be issued upon the presentation
of Kestrel Share Certificates by the owner of the shares.</I></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: -0.75in"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 19.8pt"><B>(b)</B></TD><TD
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>Share Options </B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 19.8pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -19.8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 19.8pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -19.8pt">All references
to exercise price and deemed value of options are in Australian Dollars.&#9;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: -0.75in"><I>&nbsp;</I>&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 19.8pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -1.8pt">On 11 October
2007, 3,379,077 options were issued to the participants of the share issue 
completed in the year with an exercise price of 30 cents
per share and an expiry date of 10 October 2012. These options vested 
immediately.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 19.8pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -1.8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 19.8pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -1.8pt">On 11 October
2007, 4,000,000 options were issued to key management personnel. These options 
have an exercise price of 30 cents per share and
an expiry date of 10 October 2012. These options vested immediately.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 19.8pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -1.8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">On 12 May 2008, 2,000,000 options
were granted to key management personnel. These options have an exercise price 
of 25 cents per share and an expiry date of 11 May
2013. 600,000 options vested immediately, 600,000 vested following twelve months
of service by the employee, with the remaining
800,000 vested on 1 April 2010, following twenty four months of service.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">In October and November 2009,
344,431,141 options were issued in conjunction with a rights offering completed 
by the Company at the same time. These options
have an exercise price of 1.5 cents and expire on 31 December 2012. During the 
year ended 30 June 2012 40,413,038 (2011: 70,004,681)
of these options were exercised.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">In November 2009, 1,000,000
options were issued to certain Directors. These options have an exercise price 
of 20 cents and an expiry of 30 December 2013. These
options vested immediately.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">In November 2010, 29,000,000
options were issued to the Directors. These options have an exercise price of 8 
cents per share and an expiry date of 31 October
2014. These options vested immediately.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 
0in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 59%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 0;

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify"></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: 
right">NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid">for 30 June 2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">In December 2010, 32,000,000
options were issued to employees of the Company. These options have an exercise 
price of 8 cents and an expiry date of 31 December
2014. One third of the options vested on 31 January 2011, one third vested on 31
January 2012 with the remaining third vesting
on 31 January 2013. 500,000 of these options were exercised during the year 
ended 30 June 2011.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">In July 2011, 4,000,000 options
were issued to an employee of the Company. These options have an exercise price 
of 16.4 cents and an expiry date of 31 December
2014. One third of the options vested on 31 July 2011, one third vested on 31 
July 2012 with the remaining third vesting on 31
July 2013.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">In November 2011, 4,000,000
options were issued to an Non-executive Director of the Company. These options 
have an exercise price of 15.5 cents and an expiry
date of 31 October 2015. These options vested immediately.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 19.8pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -19.8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">At the end of the year there
were 301,499,902 (2011: 322,911,075) unissued ordinary shares in respect of 
which options were outstanding. Option holders do not
have any right by virtue of the option to participate in any share issue of the 
Company.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 19.8pt"><B>(c)</B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>Terms and Conditions of Contributed 
Equity</B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 19.8pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -19.8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 19.8pt"></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: 
justify">Ordinary shares have the right to receive dividends as declared and, in
the event of winding up
the Company, to participate in the proceeds from the sale of all surplus assets 
in proportion to the number of and amounts paid
up on shares held.</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 19.8pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -19.8pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 19.8pt; 
text-align: justify">Ordinary shares entitle their
holder to one vote, either in person or by proxy, at a meeting of the 
Company.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 19.8pt; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align: 
right">NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid">for 30 June 2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Nature and purpose of reserves</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Foreign currency translation reserve</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The foreign currency translation reserve
is used to record exchange rate differences arising from the translation of 
financial statements of the Parent Entity with a functional
currency that differs to the presentation currency of the Consolidated 
Entity.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Share Based Payments Reserve</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">This reserve is used to record the value
of share based payments granted.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Equity Reserve</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">This reserve is used to recognise the difference
between the consideration paid and book value of minority interests&rsquo; 
acquired.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: normal 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top;
text-align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 0in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 1in; text-align: left"><B>NOTE 
15.</B></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>ACCUMULATED LOSSES</B></TD>

justify">Refer to note 24 for further details in
relation to the terms, conditions and valuation of the fixed forward swap and 
derivative collars.</P>
<P STYLE="font: normal 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-
align: justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: normal 10pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top;
text-align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 0in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 1in; text-align: left"><B>NOTE 
17.</B></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>COMMITMENTS</B></TD>
</TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><B>(a)</B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>Exploration Commitments</B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Due to the nature of the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s
operations in exploring and evaluating areas of interest, it is very difficult 
to accurately forecast the nature or amount of future
expenditure, although it will be necessary to incur expenditure in order to 
retain present interests. Expenditure commitments on
mineral tenure for the Consolidated Entity can be reduced by selective 
relinquishment of exploration tenure or by the renegotiation
of expenditure commitments.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The minimum level of exploration commitments
expected as at year ended 30 June 2012 is $145,000 (2011: $45,000), which 
includes the minimum amounts required to retain tenure.
It is anticipated that the exploration expenditure commitments in the ensuing 
periods will be at a similar level.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.25in"><B>(b)</B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>Development Expenditure</B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">At year end, the Company had committed
to capital development expenditure of $nil (2011: $1,943,133). None (2011<FONT 
STYLE="color: black">:$1,024,360) </FONT>of these
funds was paid prior to the end of the period and has been recorded as a 
prepayment. As at the end of the period $nil (2011:$ 305,379)
was remaining to be spent.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 
0in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 59%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 0;

    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-size: 10pt; font-weight: bold; text-align:

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="font-size: 10pt; text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Rig commitment &ndash; </I>The Consolidated
Entity has entered into a drilling contract with Frontier Drilling. The contract
is for Rig 24 and is an 18 month contract, expected
to commence on 1 November 2012. The rig is a 1,500 horsepower, diesel electric 
rig equipped with a top drive. The rig is mounted
on a box on box structure and capable of being skidded between wells on a single
Eco Pad. The commitment over 18 months is approximately
$14.2 million. The rig is a high quality rig and we have the right to sub-
contract the rig to other parties should we not be able
to utilise the rig for the full 18 months.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>(c)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating Lease Commitments &ndash;
Consolidated Entity as lessee</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Parent and its subsidiaries have entered
into operating leases for the lease of its office space in Perth, Western 
Australia and Denver, Colorado.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-weight: bold; text-align:
left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; font-weight: 
bold; text-align: right">33,107,806</TD><TD STYLE="padding-bottom: 2.5pt; font-
weight: bold; text-align: left">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">All equity transactions with key management
personnel other than those arising from the exercise of compensation options 
have been entered into under terms and conditions
no more favourable than those the Consolidated Entity would have adopted if 
dealing at arm&rsquo;s length. In the tables above
&ldquo;Net Change Other&rdquo; represents purchase of shares on market or during
capital raisings open to all shareholders.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"><B>g)</B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>Loans to key management personnel 
(Consolidated)<I> </I></B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">No loans have been granted to key management
personnel during the current or prior year.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"><B>h)</B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>Other transactions and balances with key 
management personnel</B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">There were no transactions with key management
personnel or their related parties during the current or prior year other than 
those mentioned above.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">NOTES TO THE 
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid">for 30 June 
2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top; text-align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 81pt; text-align: left"><B>NOTE 
19.</B></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>SEGMENT REPORTING</B></TD>
</TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Operating segments are now reported in
a manner that is consistent with the internal reporting provided to the chief 
operating decision maker. The chief operating decision
maker has been identified as the Board of Directors.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The group operates primarily in one business
segment being oil and gas exploration, development and production in the United 
States of America.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 
0in">The following table presents revenue and loss
information regarding geographic segments for the year ended 30 June 2011 and 
30&nbsp;June&nbsp;2012 as presented to the Board
of Directors.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White">
    <TD STYLE="text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt">Net (loss)/profit for 
the year attributable to owners of Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD><TD 
STYLE="padding-bottom: 2.5pt">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: 
left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: 
right">(31,071,439</TD><TD STYLE="padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: 
left">)</TD><TD STYLE="padding-bottom: 2.5pt">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: 
left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: 
right">47,325,185</TD><TD STYLE="padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: 
left">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">All revenue 
from the United States of America segment is from
customers based in the United States of America.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">Other 
Segments revenue relates principally to interest income
earned on cash balances in Australia.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left; width:

    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left; width:

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Ultimate parent</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited is the ultimate
parent Company.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>Other related party transactions</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">During the prior year Mr Fearis was an
alternate Director for Mr Neil MacLachlan, though was not required to act in 
this capacity. Squire Sanders, the law firm at which
Mr Fearis is Special Counsel was paid $ 18,853 for the provision of services
provided by Mr Fearis. These services were charged
on normal commercial terms. Following Mr Maclachlan resignation as a Director on
30 June 2011, Mr Fearis was no longer an alternate
Director.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">During the prior year the Consolidated
Entity paid $158,952 (including a bonus of $42,500) to Whitehall Engineering, an
entity controlled by Mr Dan Gralla for the provision
of his services. Mr Gralla became an employee of the Consolidated Entity, 
effective 1 January 2011.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.5in">There were
no other related party transactions during 2012 and 2011.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -0.5in"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 81pt"><B>NOTE 23.</B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>EARNINGS/(LOSS) PER SHARE</B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Basic earnings/(loss) per share amounts
are calculated by dividing net result for the year attributable to ordinary 
equity holders of the parent by the weighted average
number of ordinary shares outstanding during the year.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Diluted earnings/(loss) per share amounts
are calculated by dividing the net result attributable to ordinary equity 
holders of the parent by the weighted average number
of ordinary shares outstanding during the year plus the weighted average number 
of ordinary shares that would be issued on the
conversion of all dilutive potential ordinary shares into ordinary shares.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 48%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 52%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; font-weight: bold; 
text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">At the end of the current year there are
301,499,902 potential ordinary shares on issue. These potential ordinary shares 
are not dilutive for 30 June 2012.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">At the end of the prior year, there were
312,482,881 potential ordinary shares on issue that were dilutive for the year 
ended 30 June 2011.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">There have been no transactions involving
ordinary shares that would significantly change the number of ordinary shares or
potential ordinary shares outstanding between
the reporting date and the date of completion of these financial statements.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><B><I>Natural
Gas &ndash; Ratio Collar priced at Colorado Interstate
Gas</I></B></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD NOWRAP STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none; border-bottom:

    <TD>Dec 2009 &ndash; Dec 2011</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Put</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: right">440,884</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: right">4.25</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; background-color: White">
    <TD>Dec 2009 &ndash; Dec 2011</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Call</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: right">440,884</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: right">5.80</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">These terms of these derivative arrangements
are in line with Master International Swaps and Derivatives Agreement.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The fair value of these derivative instruments
is recorded in the current year balance sheet as a current or non current asset 
depending on the maturity date of the swaps. They
have been valued by the Consolidated Entity with reference to the forward curve 
for the Colorado Interstate Gas price, Henry Hub
Gas price or West Texas Intermediate for oil, for the relevant time period. Any 
movement in its fair value is taken directly to
the profit and loss. At balance date the instruments were a net asset valued at 
$nil (2011: $22,268) and the Consolidated Entity
recorded a loss in relation to the fair value movement of these instruments of 
$22,268 (2011: loss $24,557).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Following the sale of the interests in
the Jonah and Lookout Wash properties the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s exposure 
to natural gas prices decreased significantly. On
6 July 2011, the Consolidated Entity closed out the remaining gas derivative 
positions. The termination of these positions resulted
in Macquarie Bank Limited (the counter party to the hedges) paying Samson 
$36,500 in July 2011.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 30pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -30pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 63.8pt"><B>NOTE 25.</B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>CONTINGENCIES</B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 30pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -30pt"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">There are no unrecorded contingent assets
or liabilities in place for the Consolidated Entity at balance date (2011: 
$Nil).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

    <!-- Field: /Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 14.2pt; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">NOTES TO THE 
CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid">for 30 June 
2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 14.2pt; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Oil and gas properties held as jointly
controlled assets total $12,876,299 (2011: $12,758,578).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 81pt"><B>NOTE 27.</B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>EVENTS SUBSEQUENT TO BALANCE 
DATE</B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">In August 2012, the Company executed a
definative agreement to participate in the exploration of an area within the 
Williston Basin in North Dakota. Pursuant to this
agreement we acquired a 25% working interest in 23,700 acres (net 5,925 acres) 
at a price of $266 per acre. A payment of $1.58
million was made following the normal due diligence process, also in August 
2012. The exploration opportunity is a conventional
oil project that is adjacent to existing production from Mississipian aged 
reservoirs.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Except for the event disclosed above, the
Directors are not aware of any matters or circumstances not otherwise dealt with
in this report that have significantly or may
significantly affect the operations of the Consolidated Entity, the results of 
those operations or the state of affairs of the
Consolidated Entity in the subsequent financial years.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 81pt"><B>NOTE 28.</B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>FINANCIAL RISK MANAGEMENT OBJECTIVES AND POLICIES
</B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s principal
financial assets and financial liabilities comprise receivables, payables and 
cash.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity manages its exposure
to key financial risk in accordance with the Board&rsquo;s financial risk 
management strategy. The objective of the strategy is
to support the delivery of the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s financial targets 
whilst protecting future financial security.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity enters into derivative
transactions, principally oil and gas price fixed forward swaps, to manage the 
price risk arising from the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s
operations. These derivatives do not qualify for hedge accounting.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The main risks arising from the Consolidated
Entity&rsquo;s financial instruments are interest rate risk, foreign currency 
risk, credit risk, price risk and liquidity risk.
The Consolidated Entity uses different methods to measure and manage the 
different types of risks to which it is exposed. These
include monitoring levels of exposure to foreign currency and price risk and 
assessments of market forecasts for foreign exchange
and commodity prices. Ageing analysis and monitoring of specific debtors are 
undertaken to manage credit risk and liquidity risk
is monitored through the development of future rolling cash flow forecasts.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Primary responsibility for identification
and control of financial risks rests with the executive management group, 
specifically the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial
Officer, under the authority of the Board. The Board reviews and approves 
policies and strategies for managing each of the risks
identified below.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><B>Risk 
Exposures and Responses</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Capital Management</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">When managing capital, management&rsquo;s
objective is to ensure the entity continues as a going concern as well as to 
maintain optimal returns to shareholders and benefits
for other stakeholders. The Consolidated Entity funds its activities through 
capital raisings and debt funding, where appropriate.
The Consolidated Entity is not subject to any externally imposed capital 
requirements.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Interest rate risk</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity continually reviews
its interest rate exposure. Consideration is given to potential restructuring of
its existing positions and alternative financing.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity has no interest
rate risk in relation to its financial liabilities as the Consolidated Entity 
currently has no borrowings that are subject to interest.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 48%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 52%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; font-weight: bold; 
text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 69; Value: 1 -->
    <DIV STYLE="margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: right; width: 
100%">Page <!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->67<!-- Field: 
/Sequence --> of 79</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 
12pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 
100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">NOTES TO THE

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid">for 30 June 
2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s cash assets
are exposed to minimal interest rate risk. The Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s cash 
accounts are primarily held in low or no interest
rate accounts. Interest revenue is not a significant income item for the 
Consolidated Entity and the Consolidated Entity does not
rely on the cash generated from interest income.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="border-collapse: collapse; width:

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The average floating interest rate for
the Consolidated Entity in the United States was 0.16% per annum (2011: 
0.5%).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The average fixed interest rate for the
Consolidated Entity in the United States was 0.14% (2011: 0.08%).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The average floating interest rate for
the Consolidated Entity in Australia was per annum 1.09% (2011: 2.4%)</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The average fixed interest rate for the
Consolidated Entity in Australia was 5.68% per annum (2011:4.4%).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">At year end, the Consolidated Entity has
$16,215,379 (2011: $15,619,812) in short term deposits that have fixed interest 
rates. These term deposits have terms no longer
than 90 days. $5,164,396 (2011: $5,611,021) is held in an AUD term deposit and 
has an interest rate of approximately 4.9%. $11,050,983
(2011: $10,008,791) is held in an USD term deposit and has an interest rate of 
approximately 0.09%.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">At 30 June 2012 if interest rates had moved,
as illustrated in the table below (estimated from historical movements), with 
all other variables held constant, the impact would
be:</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><I>Foreign 
Currency Risk</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">As a result 
of significant operations in the United States,
the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s financial statements can be affected 
significantly by movements in the US$/A$ exchange rates.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 48%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 52%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; font-weight: bold; 
text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">The majority 
of the transactions (both revenue and expenses)
of the United States subsidiaries are denominated in US dollars.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">The 
Consolidated Entity does not have any foreign currency cash
flow hedges.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">At balance 
date, the Consolidated Entity had the following exposure

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">At 30 June
2012 if foreign exchange rates had moved, as illustrated
in the table below (estimated from historical movements), with all other

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="border-collapse: collapse; width:

    <TD COLSPAN="6" STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: center">Higher/

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">

    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: center">2012</TD><TD

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><I>Consolidated Entity</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">The impact of
the foreign exchange on the Consolidated Entity
relates to the value of assets, net of liabilities that are held in the 
Consolidated Entity which are held in the Parent Entity,
which has a functional currency of Australian Dollars.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">For the Consolidated Entity, the change
in foreign exchange rate does not have any impact on the profit and loss of the 
entity as the impact of the foreign exchange movements
is recorded in the foreign exchange reserve.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify; color: red">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Management believes the balance date risk
exposures are representative of the risk exposure inherent in the financial 
instruments.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Price risk</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Price risk arises from the Consolidated
Entity&rsquo;s exposure to oil and gas prices. These commodity prices are 
subject to wide fluctuations and market uncertainties
due to a variety of factors that are beyond the control of the Consolidated 
Entity. Sustained weakness in oil and natural gas prices
may adversely affect the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s financial condition.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity manages this risk
by continually monitoring the oil and gas price and the external factors that 
may affect it. The Board reviews the risk profile
associated with commodity price risk periodically to ensure that it is 
appropriately managing this risk. Derivatives are used to
manage this risk where appropriate. The Board must approve any derivative 
contracts that are entered into by the Company. As at
Balance Date, the Consolidated Entity does not have derivative contracts in 
place.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 48%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 52%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; font-weight: bold; 
text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
