<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Credit Risk</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity manages its credit
risk through constantly monitoring its credit exposure, to ensure it is 
acceptable.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:
justify">Credit risk arises from the financial assets
of the Consolidated Entity, which comprise cash and cash equivalents, trade and 
other receivables, and financial assets at fair
value through profit and loss. The Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s exposure to 
credit risk arises from potential default of the counter
party, with a maximum exposure equal to the carrying amount of these 
instruments. Exposure at balance date is addressed in each
applicable note.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity trades only with
recognised, creditworthy third parties, and as such collateral is not requested 
nor is it the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s policy
to securitise its trade and other receivables.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity holds its cash
with large well respected banks, with no history of default and therefore its 
credit exposure to cash is minimal. The minimum credit
rating of the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s bank is Prime-1 as determined by 
Moody&rsquo;s Rating Agency.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Receivables balances are monitored on an
ongoing basis with the result that the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s exposure to 
bad debts is not significant.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Whilst a small number of debtors account
for a large percentage of the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s receivable balance, 
the Board does not consider this a significant risk
to the Consolidated Entity as the debtors are all creditworthy with no history 
of default. As at the date of this report, the Consolidated
Entity does not have any receivables which are past their due date and the 
Consolidated Entity has not recorded any impairment
in relation to its receivables.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Liquidity Risk</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s objective
is to fund future development through cash flow from operations, equity and 
debt, where appropriate. It is the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s
policy to review the cash flow forecasts regularly to ensure that the 
Consolidated Entity can meet its obligations when they fall
due.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align:
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The table below reflects all contractual
repayments and interest resulting from recognised financial liabilities, 
including derivative instruments as of 30 June 2012. For
derivative financial instruments the market value is presented, whereas for the 
other obligations the undiscounted cash flows for
the respective upcoming fiscal years are presented. Cash flows for financial 
liabilities without fixed amounts or timing are based
on the conditions existing at 30 June 2012.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 48%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 52%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; font-weight: bold; 
text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>

    <!-- Field: /Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,

    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">NOTES TO THE

    <TD STYLE="text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid">for 30 June

0"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><B><I>The 
remaining contractual maturities of the Consolidated
Entity&rsquo;s financial liabilities are:</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="border-collapse: collapse; width: 
100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold">Trade Payables</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight:

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Consolidated Entity monitors rolling
forecasts of liquidity reserve on the basis of expected cash flow.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">At balance 
date, the Consolidated Entity does not have any unused
credit facility (2011: $nil).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><I>Fair Value
</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">The methods 
for estimating fair value and the fair value of
the financial assets and liabilities are outlined in the relevant notes to the 
financial statements.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Set out below is a comparison by category
of carrying amounts and fair values of the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s financial
instruments recognised in the financial statements.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The carrying amount of trade receivables
and payables approximates their fair value. Derivatives are carried at their 
fair value on the balance sheet. All financial assets
and liabilities are held as level 2 (quoted prices in active markets for 
identical assets or liabilities) in the fair value measurement
hierarchy.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 81pt"><B>NOTE 29.</B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>SHARE BASED PAYMENT PLANS</B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0in">The Consolidated Entity
provides benefits to employees (including senior executives) of the Consolidated
Entity in the form of share based payments, whereby
employees render services in exchange for shares or rights over shares (equity-
settled transactions).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 27pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">During the prior year, the Consolidated
Entity filed a Form S-8 with the Securities and Exchange Commission.&nbsp; The 
Form S-8 is a registration statement used by U.S.
public companies to register securities to be offered pursuant to employee 
benefit plans; in this case the ordinary shares issuable
and reserved for issuance underlying the options which may be issued pursuant to
the Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited Stock Option
Plan were registered<FONT STYLE="color: black">.</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">All references to inputs in this note are
in Australian Dollars as they refer to Australian listed securities, unless 
noted otherwise.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">During the year ended 30 June 2012, the
following share based payments were made:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Options issued to Directors</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 
0in">On 30 November 2011, 4,000,000 options were
issued to a non-Executive Director. These options have an expiry date of 31 
October 2015 and an exercise price of 15.5 cents per
share. These options have been valued at 7.62 cents per option, using a Black-
Sholes option pricing model, which takes into account
the following variables:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 
0in">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>Options issued to employees</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">In July 2011, 4,000,000 stock options were
granted under the Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited Stock Option Plan to an employee 
of the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;These options have an
exercise price of 16.4 cents and an expiry date of 31 December 2014. One third 
of these stock options vested on 31 July 2011.&nbsp;&nbsp;Another
third will vest on 31 July 2012 with the remaining third vesting on 31 July 
2013, provided the employee is still employed by the
Company on those dates. These options have been valued at 10.55 cents per 
option, using a Black-Scholes option pricing model which
takes into account the following variables:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">At year end there were 76,879,077 (2011:
69,879,077) options outstanding that had been granted to employees, Directors 
and other service providers. The weighted average
exercise price was 11 cents (2011: 10 cents) per option.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The weighted average remaining contractual
life for the share options outstanding as at 30 June 2012 is between 4 months 
and 4 years (2011: between 1 and 4 years).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The range of exercise prices for options
outstanding at the end of the year was 8-30 cents (2011: 8 &ndash; 30 
cents).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The weighted average fair value of options
granted during the year was 7.5 cents per option (2011: 3.3 cents).</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New

<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 81pt"><B>(b)</B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>Guarantees</B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">No guarantees have been entered
into by Samson Oil and Gas on behalf of its subsidiaries.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 81pt"><B>(c)</B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>Contingent liabilities of the parent 
entity</B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in;
text-align: justify">The parent entity did not have
any contingent liabilities at 30 June 2012 or 30 June 2011.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 81pt"><B>NOTE 31.</B></TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify"><B>DISCONTINUED OPERATIONS</B></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">In March 2011, the Consolidated Entity
sold its interests in the Jonah and Look Out Wash Fields in Wyoming for 
$6,300,000. The Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s interest in
this field consisted of 21% working interest in 240 acres in the Jonah field, 
located in Sweetwater County, Wyoming and 17% working
interest in approximately 20 wells in the Lookout Wash Field, Carbon County, 
Wyoming. The Consolidated Entity recognised a gain
before income tax of $159,196 in relation to this sale. These assets were 
written down to the value of the sale at 31 December
2010. The value of assets sold was $6,300,000 following this impairment. The 
profit made on the sale was a result of the Consolidated
Entity releasing the asset retirement obligation previously provided for these 
properties.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 48%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right: 
-4.1pt; font-weight: bold">Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 52%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; font-weight: bold; 
text-align: right">2012 Annual Report</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>

STYLE="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right">-</TD><TD

    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left">&nbsp;</TD><TD

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>DIRECTORS&rsquo; DECLARATION</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">In accordance with a resolution of the
Directors of Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited, I state that:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 21pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -21pt">In the opinion
of the Directors:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 21.3pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -21.3pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 21.25pt"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 21.75pt">(a)</TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify">the financial statements and notes set out on pages 
24 to 74 are in accordance with the <I>Corporations
Act 2001</I>, including :</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 43pt"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 21.75pt">(i)</TD><TD STYLE="text-
align: justify">giving a true and fair view of the Consolidated Entity&rsquo;s 
financial position as at 30 June
2012 and of its performance for the financial year ended on that date; 
and</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 63.8pt; 
text-align: justify; text-indent: -21.25pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 43pt"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 21.75pt">(ii)</TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify">complying with <I>Australian Accounting Standards, 
the Corporations Regulations 2001</I> and other
mandatory professional reporting requirements, and</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 21.25pt"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 21.75pt">(b)</TD><TD 
STYLE="text-align: justify">there are reasonable grounds to believe that the 
Company will be able to pay its debts as and when
they become due and payable.</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">Note 2(a) confirms that the financial
statements also comply with International Financial Reporting Standards as 
issued by the International Accounting Standards Board.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">The Directors have been given the declarations
by the chief executive officer and chief financial officer required by section 
295A of the <I>Corporations Act 2001.</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify">&nbsp;</P>

    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">INDEPENDENT

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid">for the year 
ended 30 June 2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: 
justify"><B>INDEPENDENT AUDIT REPORT</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><img 
src="pwclogo.jpg"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in"><B>Independent auditor's report to the members of
Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt
0.5in"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in"><B><I>Report on the financial report</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in">We 
have audited the accompanying financial report
of Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited (the company), which comprises the balance sheet
as at 30 June 2012, and the statement of comprehensive
income, statement of changes in equity and cash flow statement for the year 
ended on that date, a summary of significant accounting
policies, other explanatory notes and the directors' declaration for the Samson 
Oil &amp; Gas Group (the consolidated entity).
The consolidated entity comprises the company and the entities it controlled at 
the year's end or from time to time during the
financial year.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in"><I>Directors'responsibility for the financial report</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in">The
directors of the company are responsible for the
preparation of the financial report that gives a true and fair view in 
accordance with Australian Accounting Standards and the
<I>Corporations Act 2001 </I>and for such internal control as the directors 
determine is necessary to enable the preparation of
the financial report that is free from material misstatement, whether due to 
fraud or error. In Note 2(a), the directors also state,
in accordance with Accounting Standard AASB 1O1 <I>Presentation of Financial 
Statements, </I>that the financial statements comply
with International Financial Reporting Standards.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in"><I>Auditor's responsibility</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in">Our
responsibility is to express an opinion on the
financial report based on our audit. We conducted our audit in accordance with 
Australian Auditing Standards. These Auditing Standards
require that we comply with relevant ethical requirements relating to audit 
engagements and plan and perform the audit to obtain
reasonable assurance whether the financial report is free from material 
misstatement.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in">An 
audit involves performing procedures to obtain
audit evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the financial report. The 
procedures selected depend on the auditor's judgement,
including the assessment of the risks of material misstatement of the financial 
report, whether due to fraud or error. In making
those risk assessments, the auditor considers internal control relevant to the 
entity's preparation and fair presentation of the
financial report in order to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the
circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing
an opinion on the effectiveness of the entity's internal control. An audit also
includes evaluating the appropriateness of accounting
policies used and the reasonableness of accounting estimates made by the 
directors, as well as evaluating the overall presentation
of the financial report.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in">Our
procedures include reading the other information
in the Annual Report to determine whether it contains any material 
inconsistencies with the financial report.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: justify">We believe that the audit evidence
we have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our audit 
opinions.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in"><I>Independence</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: left">In conducting our audit, we have
complied with the independence requirements of the <I>Corporations Act 
2001.</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: left">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: left"></P>
<!-- Field: Rule-Page --><DIV STYLE="text-align: left; margin-top: 3pt; margin-
bottom: 3pt; margin-left: 0.5in"><DIV STYLE="font-size: 1pt; border-top: Black 
1pt solid; width: 100%">&nbsp;</DIV></DIV><!-- Field: /Rule-Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: left">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: left"><B><I>PricewaterhouseCoopers, ABN
52 780 433 757</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: left"><I>QV1, S50 St Georges Terrace,
PERTH WA 6000, GPO Box D198, PERTH WA 6840</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-align: left; text-decoration: none"><I>T: +61 8 9238 3000, F: +61 8

0.5in"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

0.5in"><FONT STYLE="font-weight: normal">Liability limited
by a scheme approved under Professional Standards Legislation.</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>

    <TD STYLE="width: 48%; border-top: windowtext 1pt solid; padding-right:

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 78; Value: 1 -->
    <DIV STYLE="margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Black 1pt 
solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 10pt

    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom:

    <!-- Field: /Page -->
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; font-weight: bold; text-align: right">INDEPENDENT 
AUDIT REPORT</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid">for the year 
ended 30 June 2012</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><img 
src="pwclogo.jpg"></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 
0"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in"><B>Independent auditor's report to the members of
Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited (continued)</B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in"><I>Auditor's opinion</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in">In 
our opinion:</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-indent: 0in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in">(a)</TD><TD>the financial
report of Samson Oil &amp; Gas Limited is in accordance with the <I>Corporations
Act 2001, </I>including:</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1.5in; 
text-indent: -0.5in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 1in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in">(i)</TD><TD>giving a true 
and fair view of the consolidated entity's financial position as at 30 June 2012
and of its performance for the
year ended on that date; and</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-indent: 0in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 1in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in">(ii)</TD><TD>complying with
Australian Accounting Standards (including the Australian Accounting 
Interpretations) and the <I>Corporations
Regulations 2001; </I>and</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in; 
text-indent: 0in">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-
align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 0.5in"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 0.5in">(b)</TD><TD>the financial
report also complies with International Financial Reporting Standards as 
disclosed in Note 2(a)</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 1in; text-
indent: -0.5in">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in"><B><I>Report on the Remuneration Report</I></B></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in">We 
have audited the remuneration report included in
pages 6 to 14 of the directors' report for the year ended 30 June 2012. The 
directors of the company are responsible for the preparation
and presentation of the remuneration report in accordance with section 300A of 
the <I>Corporations Act 2001. </I>Our responsibility
is to express an opinion on the remuneration report, based on our audit 
conducted in accordance with Australian Auditing Standards.</P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in"><I>&nbsp;</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in"><I>Auditor's opinion</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in">In 
our opinion, the remuneration report of Samson
Oil &amp; Gas Limited for the year ended 30 June 2012, complies with section
300A of the <I>Corporations Act 2001.</I></P>
<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 
0.5in">&nbsp;</P>
